feed.title: Celina Chang
feed.subtitle: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

entry.title: Muqo
entry.content:
Muqo is a new and upcoming music and social networking app. The social app allows users to add music from their libraries to their social media post.

Muqo was a client that asked for a simple website to showcase their new app. The purpose of the website was for users to find more information on the app and find the download link when it becomes available.

I designed the Muqo website to be a simple, one-pager site. The menu buttons takes users to the appropriate section. The colour scheme of Muqo was red and white, therefore the website was revolved around these two colours. The link to the website can be found here.

After I finished the website, my client asked for a logo redesign/touch-up. Requests include raising the left side of the "u" and reorienting the microphone. I simplified the "O" and retraced the microphone in vector format. The original logo can be seen on the left (top) and the new logo on the right (bottom).

Logo Redesign

Website Design
entry.summary: Muqo is a new and upcoming music and social networking app. The social app allows users to add music from their libraries to their social media post.

entry.title: Electronic Arts
entry.content:
In Fall 2017, I worked at Electronic Arts as an Associate Product Manager Co-op on the FIFA Mobile Live team. FIFA Mobile is a football simulation mobile game developed by EA Mobile.

I joined the team during the development of FIFA Mobile Season 2. My responsibilities included participating in the design process and implementation of new events and programs, documenting new features and events on Confluence, maintaining base content, and updating weekly events.

I designed and implemented the layout of the Rest of the World campaign and redesigned some layouts of other existing campaigns to produce a more cohesive UI and design. Some issues with previous layouts included spacing, aesthetics, and UI. When redesigning the layouts, restrictions included keeping the connection of nodes and the number of nodes the same. Below are some images of the design and redesign process of the campaign layouts.

Campaign design process

Screenshots
entry.summary: In Fall 2017, I worked at Electronic Arts as an Associate Product Manager Co-op on the FIFA Mobile Live team. FIFA Mobile is a football simulation mobile game developed by EA Mobile.

entry.title: Spotly
entry.content:
Spotly is a web application that allows users to share and track their fitness progress. This project is currently in progress with 2 other developers. I hold the responsibility of designing the UI and visual appearance of the web-site as well as implementing the front-end. The front-end is currently being implemented with HTML, CSS/SASS, and JavaScript. Below are the initial mock-ups of the website.

The project can be found at Spotly.
entry.summary: Spotly is a web application that allows users to share and track their fitness progress. This project is currently in progress with 2 other developers. I hold the responsibility of designing the UI and visual appearance of the web-site as well as implementing the front-end. The front-end is currently being implemented with HTML, CSS/SASS, and JavaScript. Below are the initial mock-ups of the website. The project can be found at Spotly.

entry.title: Portfolio Design
entry.content:
Every co-op term, I usually redesign my personal website due to new design practices and mostly to apply new skills I have obtained or old skills that I have improved. This term, the focus of the portfolio design was of course, the portfolio content. I wanted more pictures and less words which I tried to convey in my old design, but unfortunately it was poorly executed.

My old personal website was a one-page website and used JQuery to swap content in and out. This time, I learned to use Jekyll to set up templates and make swapping content more efficient. Below are a couple of mockups of potential portfolio designs created with Sketch.
entry.summary: Every co-op term, I usually redesign my personal website due to new design practices and mostly to apply new skills I have obtained or old skills that I have improved. This term, the focus of the portfolio design was of course, the portfolio content. I wanted more pictures and less words which I tried to convey in my old design, but unfortunately it was poorly executed.

entry.title: TD Lab
entry.content: I worked at TD Lab—TD Bank Group as a UI/UX Designer. The project we worked on was a mobile application. The application would have a feed and an onboarding componen and I was responsible for designing these components. A quick wireframe of the onboarding carousel is shown below. Multiple layout options for the feed is also shown below. These mock-ups were made with Sketch.
entry.summary: I worked at TD Lab—TD Bank Group as a UI/UX Designer. The project we worked on was a mobile application. entry.title: Rave Media Redesign
entry.content:
WeMesh Inc. (rebranded as Rave Media) is a company located in Waterloo. The company developed a social video playback app where users can watch videos with friends and chat about it in real time.

I worked at WeMesh before it was rebranded as Rave Media as a UI/UX Designer. After seeing the new theme and logo, I experimented with the layout and colour scheme of the app.

The colours of the new logo were black and white as opposed to the original red logo. I first tried out black and very dark gray as the main colour in the background. The dark background gives the app a cinematic feel and is easier on the eyes. I also tried the layout with a white background and it gave the app a very clean and neat look. Another theme I attempted was adding a red accent colour, referencing back to the old red logo.

Main screen layout

Chat layout
entry.summary: WeMesh Inc. (rebranded as Rave Media) is a company located in Waterloo. The company developed a social video playback app where users can watch videos with friends and chat about it in real time.

entry.title: WeMesh Presskit
entry.content: As a UI/UX Designer at WeMesh (rebranded as Rave), I was tasked with designing and implementing the presskit for the company's website. I used Bootstrap and JavaScript/JQuery to implement the webpage. Below is a quick snapshot of the presskit.

entry.title: Odin with Friends
entry.content:
Odin with Friends is a hackathon project that I participated in when I was a QA Engineer Co-op at Zynga Inc. It was a 3 day project. The concept of the game was based on the office dog, Odin. The team decided to based the game off of Flappy Bird. As a result, Odin with Friends became a multiplayer version of Flappy Bird with the addition of horizontal controls. Players can propel themselves forward or backgrounds in addition to jumping over obstacles.

My role in Odin with Friends was the visual appearance of the game and creating game assets such as sprites, backgrounds, obstacles, splashscreen, and more. The husky on the left (or above if on mobile) is Odin, as well as the app icon.

The visual style of the game was decided to be a pixel style to reflect on the style of Flappy Bird and due to time constraints. This was my first attempt at pixel art. Below is the home screen to Odin with Friends and the background of the game.

I used Photoshop to create all the assets as well as the homescreen and background. The gif animation of Odin was done with 3 frames in Photoshop. Odin was then edited to make a second player, a shibainu. Below are mockups of the game screens.
entry.summary: Odin with Friends is a hackathon project that I participated in when I was a QA Engineer Co-op at Zynga Inc. It was a 3 day project. The concept of the game was based on the office dog, Odin. The team decided to based the game off of Flappy Bird. As a result, Odin with Friends became a multiplayer version of Flappy Bird with the addition of horizontal controls. Players can propel themselves forward or backgrounds in addition to jumping over obstacles. My role in Odin with Friends was the visual appearance of the game and creating game assets such as sprites, backgrounds, obstacles, splashscreen, and more. The husky on the left (or above if on mobile) is Odin, as well as the app icon.

entry.title: Spartans Speak
entry.content:
Spartans Speak is a North Surrey Secondary's school magazine club. My role at the club was Head Designer of the magazine that we produced bi-monthly. I had full control over the design of the magazine. My duties included planning out the full layout of each issue, finding assets, taking photos, and deciding how articles are ordered. The magazines were designed with InDesign and Photoshop. You can view the November 2013 edition here.

This overall theme of this edition focused on the school colours: red, black, and white. The design of each article was tailored to its content. Below are some page layouts designed in the November 2013 Edition.
entry.summary: Spartans Speak is a North Surrey Secondary's school magazine club. My role at the club was Head Designer of the magazine that we produced bi-monthly. I had full control over the design of the magazine. My duties included planning out the full layout of each issue, finding assets, taking photos, and deciding how articles are ordered. The magazines were designed with InDesign and Photoshop. You can view the November 2013 edition here.
